body:
What steps will reproduce the problem? First game in a duel, I was dealt a hand with no lands, and offered to take a mulligan, which I did. Even though I did get a land this time, I was offered a mulligan again. I took this one, too, out of curiosity - and was offered a third one in a row (which I declined this time).

After that, I was offered a mulligan on every single subsequent game, even though I always had lands in the dealt hand. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: no mulligan unless a hand is dealt with no lands. Actual: if you are offered a mulligan once, you are offered one in every game. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Magarena 1.26 on WinXP
author: [i...@tandetnik.org](https://code.google.com/u/100964988663965718405/)
title: Mulligan offered on every game

comments.body:
You are thinking of older rulings. 

The current rules are different:
103.4
A player who is dissatisfied with his or her initial hand may take a mulligan.

**Status:** WontFix
